result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Hearing on August 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

10:05 AM Defendant Marcus D Williams in court with attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse.  Chelsea Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary. 
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 6, 2022 at 09:15 am.

01:43 PM Defendant Marcus D Williams appeared by Zoom with attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Abigail Kincheloe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  The Court orders the defendant to appear by Zoom at the next hearing and Zoom would not be available.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Letter to defendant with attorney's information.
Hearing on June 3, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
01:05 PM Defendant Marcus D Williams in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court calls the matter for a Status of Counsel.
The Court recess at 01:09 PM for the Defendant to fill out the Petition for Court Appointed Counsel paperwork.
The Court recalls the matter at 01:46 PM with the same appearances.
Defendant requests the court appoint counsel.  Court swears defendant.  Court grants request, repayment at the rate of $150.00 per month commencing June 15, 2022.
THE COURT ORDERS THE DEFENDANT TO GO TO THE BUSINESS CENTER (Rm. 112) RIGHT AFTER COURT TO SET UP A WAGE ASSIGNMENT.
Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
THE COURT AUTHORIZES ZOOM.  Hearing scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Marcus D Williams
Current: 5253 N 90Th St, 1, Milwaukee, WI 53225   (Effective: 05-27-2022)
Prior: 5253 N 90Th St, 1, Milwaukee, WI 53225
Notice Regarding US Passport for Criminal Defendant

If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes. Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with victims A-F/witness A/North Middle School listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.  Defendant not to leave the State of Wisconsin without prior authorization from the Court.  Defendant to surrender their passport to the Waukesha Criminal Traffic Office (Room C226) within 2 business days of being released from custody.  Defendant is not permitted to apply for the issuance,  duplicate nor renewal of a passport and/or passport card during the pendency of this action.

03:45 PM Defendant Marcus D Williams in court, in custody, with attorney Ricardo Tapia.   Attorney appears as friend of the court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  
Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Bugenhagen Jr. on May 23, 2022.

To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key.
